resources.string: Select which hand to test first
Select which arm to test first
Select which leg to test first
Select which arm to calibrate first
Select which leg to calibrate first
Average normalized response time for each hand (millisec/pixel)

NOTE: First calibrate your device if you have not already done so

 Arm Curl Test:
 1.Place device on the inside of your forearm with the screen facing out and the top of the phone closest to your wrist.

 2.Begin with your arm by your side stretched downward.

 3.Curl your arm upward so the inside of your forearm attempts to touch your shoulder, then lower your arm to your size, stretched downward.

 4.Repeat this as many times as possible in the allotted time.


Leg Curl Test:
 1.Sit so that your thigh is parallel to the ground. Place the device on your thigh so that the screen is facing up and the top of the phone is close to your knee.

 2.Begin with your foot on the ground.

 3.Lift your foot up and off of the ground, then lower your foot back to the ground.

 4.Repeat as many times as possible in the allotted time.

Arm Calibration:
 1.Place device on the inside of your forearm with the screen facing out and the top of the phone closest to your wrist.

 2.Place your arm by your side with your arm stretched downward as far as possible – press “BEGIN” and wait for the time to end.

 3.Curl your arm upward so the inside of your forearm attempts to touch your shoulder – press “BEGIN” and wait for the time to end.

 Leg Calibration:
 1.Sit so that your thigh is parallel to the ground. Place the device on your thigh so that the screen is facing up and the top of the phone is close to your knee.

 2.Keep your foot on the ground – press “BEGIN” and wait for the time to end.

 3.Lift your foot up off of the ground – press “BEGIN” and wait for the time to end
